Input to this function is a string containing multiple groups of nested brackets, the goal of which is to split this group into separate strings and return the vector of them. Separate groups are balanced (each open bracket is properly closed) and not nested.
>>> separate_paren_groups("( ) (( )) (( )( ))")
{"()", "(())", "(()())"}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
#include<string>
using namespace std;
vector<string> separate_paren_groups(string paren_string){
    vector<string> paren_groups;
    string current_paren_group = "";
    for(int i = 0; i < paren_string.length(); i++){
        if(paren_string[i] == '('){
            current_paren_group += paren_string[i];
        }
        else if(paren_string[i] == ')'){
            paren_groups.push_back(current_paren_group);
            current_paren_group = "";
        }
        else{
            current_paren_group += paren_string[i];
        }
    }
    paren_groups.push_back(current_paren_group);
    return paren_groups;
}

>>> special_factorial(4)
288

The function will receive an integer as input and should return the special
factorial of this integer.
*/
#include<stdio.h>
using namespace std;
long long special_factorial(int n){
    long long fact = 1;
    for(int i = 1; i <= n; i++){
        fact *= i;
    }
    return fact;
}

#include<math.h>

using namespace std;
double poly(vector<double> xs, double x){
    /* 
    Evaluates polynomial with coefficients xs at point x. return xs[0] + xs[1] * x + xs[1] * x^2 +.... xs[n] * x^n 
    */
    double sum=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++)
    {
        sum+=xs[i]*pow(x,i);
    }
    return sum;
}

double find_zero(vector<double> xs){
    /*
    xs are coefficients of a polynomial. find_zero find x such that poly(x) = 0. find_zero returns only only zero point, even if there are many. 
    Moreover, find_zero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees a solution.
    >>> round(find_zero([1, 2]), 2) #f(x) = 1 + 2x 
    -0.5 
    >>> round(find_zero([-6, 11, -6, 1]), 2) # (x - 1) * (x - 2) * (x - 3) = -6 + 11x - 6x^2 + x^3 
    1.0
    */
    double x=0, y=0;
    int i;
    for (i=0;i<xs.size();i++){
        if (xs[i]!=0){
            y=xs[i];
            break;
        }
    }
    for (i=xs.size();i>0;i--){
        if (xs[i]!=0){
            x=xs[i-1];
            break;
        }
    }
    return x;
}

Examples:

strange_sort_vector({5, 5, 5, 5}) == {5, 5, 5, 5}
strange_sort_vector({}) == {}

<|endoftext|>/*
You are given a 2 dimensional data, as a nested vectors,
which is similar to matrix, however, unlike matrices,
each row may contain a different number of columns.
Given lst, and integer x, find integers x in the vector,
and return vector of vectors, {{x1, y1}, {x2, y2}...} such that
each vector is a coordinate - {row, columns}, starting with 0.
Sort coordinates initially by rows in ascending order.
Also, sort coordinates of the row by columns in descending order.

Examples:
get_row({
  {1,2,3,4,5,6},
  {1,2,3,4,1,6},
  {1,2,3,4,5,1}
}, 1) == {{0, 0}, {1, 4}, {1, 0}, {2, 5}, {2, 0}}
get_row({}, 1) == {}
get_row({{}, {1}, {1, 2, 3}}, 3) == {{2, 2}}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<vector<int>> get_row(vector<vector<int>> lst, int x){
    vector<vector<int>> res;
    vector<int> row;
    vector<int> col;
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        row.push_back(i);
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        col.push_back(i);
    }
    for(int i = 0; i < lst.size(); i++){
        for(int j = 0; j < lst.at(i).size(); j++){
            if(lst.at(i).at(j) == x){
                res.push_back(row);
                res.push_back(col);
            }
        }
    }
    return res;
}

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a vector of the rotating maximum element from a given vector of integers that was found up to a given moment in the sequence.
>>> rolling_max({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4, 4}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_max(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int max = numbers[0];
    int max_index = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] > max){
            max = numbers[i];
            max_index = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(max);
    result.push_back(numbers[max_index]);
    return result;
}
/*
Create a vector of the rotating minimum element from a given vector of integers that was found up to a given moment in the sequence.
>>> rolling_min({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 2, 1}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_min(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int min = numbers[0];
    int min_index = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] < min){
            min = numbers[i];
            min_index = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(min);
    result.push_back(numbers[min_index]);
    return result;
}
/*
Create a vector of the rotating median element from a given vector of integers that was found up to a given moment in the sequence.
>>> rolling_median({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 2, 2}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_median(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int median = numbers[0];
    int median_index = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] < median && numbers[i] > numbers[median_index]){
            median = numbers[i];
            median_index = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(median);
    result.push_back(numbers[median_index]);
    return result;
}
/*
Create a vector of the rotating mode element from a given vector of integers that was found up to a given moment in the sequence.
>>> rolling_mode({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 2, 3, 4, 2, 2}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_mode(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int mode = numbers[0];
    int mode_index = -1;
    for(int i = 1; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        if(numbers[i] > mode && numbers[i]!= numbers[mode_index]){
            mode = numbers[i];
            mode_index = i;
        }
    }
    result.push_back(mode);
    result.push_back(numbers[mode_index]);
    return result;
}
/*
Create a vector of the rotating sum element from a given vector of integers that was found up to a given moment in the sequence.
>>> rolling_sum({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_sum(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    result.push_back(sum);
    result.push_back(numbers[numbers.size()-1]);
    return result;
}
/*
Create a vector of the rotating variance element from a given vector of integers that was found up to a given moment in the sequence.
>>> rolling_variance({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_variance(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    double mean = sum / numbers.size();
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        double diff = numbers[i] - mean;
        double variance = diff * diff;
        result.push_back(variance);
        result.push_back(numbers[numbers.size()-1]);
    }
    return result;
}
/*
Create a vector of the rotating standard deviation element from a given vector of integers that was found up to a given moment in the sequence.
>>> rolling_standard_deviation({1, 2, 3, 2, 3, 4, 2})
{1, 2, 3, 3, 4, 4, 5}
*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<vector>
using namespace std;
vector<int> rolling_standard_deviation(vector<int> numbers){
    vector<int> result;
    int sum = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        sum += numbers[i];
    }
    double mean = sum / numbers.size();
    for(int i = 0; i < numbers.size(); i++){
        double diff = numbers[i] - mean;
        double variance = diff * diff;
        result.push_back(variance);
        result.push_back(numbers[numbers.size()-1]);
    }
    double variance = result.back();
    for(int i = 0; i < result.size(); i++){
        result[i] /= variance;
    }
    return result;
}

next_smallest({1, 2, 3, 4, 5}) == 2

<|endoftext|>/*
Create a function consisting of 3 numbers. Returns true if one of the numbers is the sum of the other two and all numbers are integers. Returns false in all other cases.

Examples
any_int(5, 2, 7) ➞ true

any_int(3, 2, 2) ➞ false

any_int(3, -2, 1) ➞ true

any_int(3.6, -2.2, 2) ➞ false



*/
#include<stdio.h>
#include<math.h>
using namespace std;
bool any_int(float a,float b,float c){
    float sum=a+b+c;
    float num=a+b+c;
    float den=a+b+c;
    if(num==sum&&den==1){
        return true;
    }
    else{
        return false;
    }
}
